quote: I'm not the manager, thank God. I just hope (Bonds) is in the lineup to bat somewhere. I think we all know what we're up against, and especially he knows what he's up against.

quote: Only God and he know how much he's going to play. And the manager.

author: Brian Sabean
quote: By what I see, do I think he's capable of playing a lot? Yes. Only God and he knows how much he's going to play, and the manager.

author: Brian Sabean
quote: His stuff has been electric. He's throwing strikes and the breaking ball is improved. I think his future, and the impact he could have on the major-league roster, it looks like he'll probably start the year in the bullpen.

quote: Todd brings a veteran presence to the team and he'll be one of the catchers in the competition for the backup spot behind Mike Matheny.

author: Brian Sabean

author: Brian Sabean
quote: Him taking swings in a college batting cage is a long way from doing baseball work with us, ... It's just another step in his rehab. To what extent this is of any significance -- until I'm told otherwise -- it's just part of the exercise regimen he's going through. Once he's accelerated to the point where the doctors are ready to turn him over to us, then he can do more meaningful and substantial baseball activities. But for now, this is just another step.

author: Brian Sabean
quote: Spring training was a long time ago. He could be starting from ground zero as far as the baseball activities.

author: Brian Sabean
quote: I don't go that deep. It's all about our budget. We answer to a higher authority -- which is our lender.

author: Brian Sabean
quote: I'm swallowing hard. I'm really trying to fathom how in this day in age it can even be said. This is not something we're going to take lightly. It's a very emotional subject. It's a blow below the belt. I know it deeply affected Felipe. I'm disappointed and disheartened we have to react to it. We stand by our manager and stand by his comments and feelings on the subject.

author: Brian Sabean
quote: To get a switch-hitter (who is) a leadoff hitter with a lot of dimensions -- power, speed -- the ability to play the outfield as he does is really a godsend to the organization.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: There's a big overlap with the people you meet at the fantasy and science fiction cons.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: There are interactions with characters within the game which I think are pretty neatly done considering the limitations that you have to work with. I mean, a computer can't really generate a character that talks back and forth with you successfully.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: The Swords were still interesting but by then a cast of characters had started to appear and go on from book to book, and other things about the world began to feel constricting. And there were other things I wanted to do, so I closed the series up and stopped it.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: The same tools that make any writer good, plus a cheerful willingness to suspend belief.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: The critics and reviewers of a hundred years from now, if they remember any of us at all, may have opinions much different from those of today.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: The comments I most appreciate come from ordinary readers who've happened on one of my books at some time of stress in their lives, and who actually credit the book with helping them through a bad time. It's happened a few times in forty years.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: The Berserkers have been with me for about forty years, and we're not done yet.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: The advice would be the same for any kind of fiction. Keep writing, and keep sending things out, not to friends and relatives, but to people who have the power to buy. A lot of additional, useful tips could be added, but this is fundamental.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: Research is of considerable importance in certain fields, such as science and history.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: Probably all the books I've ever written have been efforts to define the boundaries of humanity.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: Only towards the end of this process are any of the chapters in fully readable condition, a state of affairs that used to alarm my wife. But Joan's got used to it.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: Mysteries I read for fun, so I will probably never write one, for fear of spoiling the fun.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: My gut feeling is that paper and ink are going to be with us for a long time yet, and in substantial quantities, though certainly books are now going to be available in other forms.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: More immediately, I'm currently working on another Dracula in which there will be connections with ancient Egypt. That's about as far as I want to go in commenting on current work.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: If people ask me for the ingredients of success, I say one is talent, two is stubbornness or determination, and third is sheer luck. You have to have two out of the three. Any two will probably do.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: I wrote speculative fiction because I loved to read it, and thought I could do better than some of the people who were getting published.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: I wouldn't like to just do one story or one type of stories all the time.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: I suspect that writer's block afflicts mainly people who have some stable and ample source of income outside of writing. So far it hasn't been a problem.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: I started writing seriously about 1960, at the fairly advanced age of 30.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: I have some good stories yet to tell.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: I had immediate success in the sense that I sold something right off the bat. I thought it was going to be a piece of cake and it really wasn't. I have drawers full of - or I did have - drawers full of rejection slips.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: I guess if one set of my books was selling like Stephen King's, and the other wasn't selling at all, editors would want me to do the ones that sold like Stephen King's. But they seem to be willing to let me pick what I want to do next.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: I finally decided one day, reading science fiction magazines of the time, I could do at least as well as some of these people are doing. So I finally made a serious effort.

author: Fred Saberhagen

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: I don't know why a computer game can't be an art form just as a puppet show or an opera is. I'm still interested in computer games as something I would like to work on someday.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: I am generally way out of touch with trends, except now and then I am surprised to find myself leading one, like sympathetic vampires.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: Doing a work for hire is not necessarily bad, whether it's an encyclopedia article or a tie-in novel. It's just that you get no royalties.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: At this stage, my chief professional goal is simply to keep on writing and making a living at it.

author: Fred Saberhagen
quote: And what we know, or think we know, about the universe of space and time is changing very quickly.

author: Fred Saberhagen

author: Naji Sabri
quote: The aggression has to stop,

author: Jeffrey Sachs

author: Jeffrey Sachs
quote: Development can really work everywhere. But most of sub-Saharan Africa, the Andean region, and Central Asia face obstacles.

author: Jeffrey Sachs

author: Jeffrey Sachs

quote: I think the IMF helped to detonate the Indonesian crisis.

author: Paul Saffo
quote: With more technologies, there are more choices. Choose wisely and well. You don't have to read every e-mail you get; you need to develop your own rules of thumb and steps to sanity.

author: Marat Safin
quote: I've been out for one month and a half and I didn't really practice before the tournament,

author: Marat Safin
quote: I didn't practice for one month and a half and I played three matches in a row and today I felt really, really tired on the court. I couldn't move properly and I couldn't find my game. My timing was not there. So it's really difficult to play against any player.

author: Marat Safin
quote: It's kind of difficult. It (the knee injury) is still in my head. When you feel some pain in some movements, you try to avoid those. After the first couple of games, I tried to forget about it and focus on the game.

author: Marat Safin
quote: Maybe I went for it too much, ... I started to make mistakes and I became frustrated as he became more solid.

author: Marat Safin
quote: It was not enough matches, so many mistakes. Like I've said, you need to get the rhythm back. It doesn't come straight away. It's still a long way and I have many things to work on. I hope it will come back soon.

author: Marat Safin
quote: But, despite all that, I have a lot more good memories than bad of being here and I would love to come back next year.

author: Marat Safin
quote: It's been a tough week for me. But I am satisfied with my game.

author: Marat Safin
quote: We were both fighting against each other and fighting against ourselves, ... Neither us of wanted to lose, and I think that given the [windy] conditions, we played good tennis.

author: Marat Safin
quote: it's more actually [that] I need to hold it. I need to hold these feelings and I need to hold it for a long time, as long as I can. Because now it looks like I found my game, I found the confidence that I was missing for past six months. I'll try not to lose it again.

author: Marat Safin
quote: We have eyes, and we see that not many people are interested in the sports.

author: Marat Safin

quote: It is a good excuse,

author: Marat Safin
quote: I was missing a little bit of energy. I got sick two, three days ago, and I'm still a little bit weak.

author: Marat Safin
quote: There was so much wind, it was tough to play good tennis. I'm having trouble getting my confidence back. But I'm working hard and trying to do it.

author: Marat Safin
quote: New York is a fantastic city.

quote: Leo, what's with Scorsese and music,

author: Bob Saget
quote: You can talk about things indirectly, but if you want to talk how people really talk, you have to talk R-rated, ... When a normal 17-year-old girl storms out of the house or 15-year-old boy is mad at his mom or dad, they're not talking the way people talk on TV. Unless it's cable.

author: Bob Saget
quote: The film, as crazy as it is, is a love letter to comedians and comedy and all the different ways they improv around something,

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Creator has made me His Own. He has destroyed the city of sorrow.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Everyone makes mistakes; only the Guru and the Creator are infallible.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: In deep humility, I fall at the Feet of the Perfect True Guru. The Guru is the Honor of the dishonored. The Guru, the True Guru, brings approval and applause.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When the Husband does not enjoy His bride, then her youth passes away in vain.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Be happy, dear beloved, as long as your youth is fresh and delightful. But your days are few - you have grown weary, and now your body has grown old.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, the shaven-headed ones are devils. They are not pleased to hear these words. When it rains, there is happiness. Water is the key to all life. When it rains, the corn grows, and the sugar cane, and the cotton, which provides clothing for all.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You may enjoy the pleasures of hundreds of thousands of women, and rule the nine continents of the world. But without the True Guru, you will not find peace; you will be reincarnated over and over again.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: But when the swan departs, you shall remain behind, like an abandoned woman.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Without the One, there is no other at all. O Baba Nanak, this is the most excellent wisdom.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: In the cave of intuitive wisdom I sit, absorbed in the silent trance of the Primal Void. I have obtained my seat in the heavens.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Your Face is so Beautiful, and the Sound of Your Words imparts intuitive wisdom. It is so long since this sparrow-hawk has had even a glimpse of water.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: All are Yours, and You belong to all. You are the wealth of all. Everyone begs from You, and all offer prayers to You each day. Those, unto whom You give, receive everything.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The dream is His, and the kingdom is His; He who has given the wealth of Maya, has infused the desire for it.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The sparrow-hawk loves the rainwater, falling in torrents; the king loves to see his wealth on display.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: True wealth does not burn; it cannot be stolen by a thief.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: All beings and creatures, wealth and property belong to Him. O Nanak, it is so difficult to describe and contemplate Him.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Without God's Name, there is no other wealth. Everything else is just poison and ashes.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: With him i have obtained the priceless wealth, which shall never leave me or go anywhere else.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: True wealth does not drown, and its owner is never punished.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: This wealth is all-pervading, permeating all.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Gazing upon the Fruitful Vision of His Darshan, I have been saved. Blessed are the hours, the minutes and the seconds - blessed is that Union with Him.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Forever fruitful is the Blessed Vision of His Darshan; He is Infinite and Incomparable. He is Awesome and All-powerful; He is forever the Great Giver.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I have searched and searched, seeking the Blessed Vision of His Darshan. I travelled through all sorts of woods and forests.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The counterfeit coins are not put into the Treasury; they do not obtain the Blessed Vision of the Lord-Guru.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: without the Blessed Vision of my Beloved, how can I enjoy Him?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Without the Guru, spiritual wisdom is not obtained; other tastes are poison. Without virtue, nothing is of any use. The taste of Maya is bland and insipid.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: They all call themselves virtuous, but I have no virtue at all.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Master's Name is Priceless; no one knows its value.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He is the Master who has made the world bloom; He makes the Universe blossom forth, fresh and green.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The jewel of spiritual wisdom was placed within the universe.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He Himself created and adorned the Universe, and He Himself contemplates it. Some are counterfeit, and some are genuine. He Himself is the Appraiser.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You impart understanding, and You unite us in Your Union.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Give me that understanding, by which I may meditate on You. I sing Your Glorious Praises with each and every breath. Nanak takes the Support of the Guru's Feet.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The angelic beings and the silent sages long for Him; the True Guru has given me this understanding.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Divine Light within is revealed, O Nanak, through this intuitive understanding.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: One who recognizes the Guru practices Truth; why should he be afraid?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those who have gathered Truth, speak Truth; they apply the Touch-stone of Truth.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: All the world is liberated, O Nanak, by embarking upon the Boat of Truth.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: They see the Truth, and they speak the Truth; their bodies and minds are True. True are their teachings, and True are their instructions; True are the reputations of the true ones.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Through true devotional worship, they are attuned to Truth; at the True Door, they are found to be true. Blessed is their coming into being; they redeem all their ancestors.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Attuned to Truth, you shall obtain the True One.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: From the True One alone comes Truth.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Loading the Merchandise of the True Name, you shall gather in your profits forever with the Capital of Truth.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He Himself is True; Truth is pleasing to His Will. The spiritually blind are unripe and imperfect, inferior and worthless.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, the Boat of Truth will ferry you across; contemplate the Guru. Some come, and some go; they are totally filled with egotism.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: They hear the Truth, and speak it with their mouths.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those who please You are linked to the Truth. They serve the True One forever, with intuitive ease.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The true ones find the gate of salvation. True is their paper, pen and ink; writing Truth, they are absorbed in the True One.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those who are attuned to Truth, remain balanced and detached forever.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When You are with me, what more could I want? I speak only the Truth.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those who walk on the Path of Truth shall be praised throughout the world.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: In all the world, the most blessed and sanctified are those who remain absorbed in Truth.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those, within whom the Truth dwells, obtain the True Name; they speak only the Truth.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When one speaks the Truth, a bond is established with the Holy Scriptures.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Seek and find those who are imbued with Truth; they are so rare in this world

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Baba, write such an account, that when it is asked for, it will bring the Mark of Truth.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Wine of Truth is not fermented from molasses.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Some trade in priceless jewels, while others deal in mere glass.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: My farming and my trading are by the Support of the Name.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I stand tall; You are my Strength. I know that You are mine. Inside of all, and outside of all, You are our Self-sufficient Father. O Father, I do not know - how can I know Your Way?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You are the strength of the weak. He is not known through burnt offerings and ritual chanting

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Through the perfect karma of good deeds, one meets the Perfect Guru, whose speech is perfect.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The soul becomes steady, and does not waver, by the natural inclination of the Guru's Loving Will.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Guru's Word is always with the soul.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The True One does not die, and shall not go. He continually enjoys His happy soul-bride; He casts His Gracious Glance of Truth upon her, and she abides in His Will.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Haven't you heard the call from beyond, O beautiful soul-bride? You must go to your in-laws; you cannot stay with your parents forever.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The jewel of the soul is priceless, and yet it is being squandered like this, in exchange for a mere shell.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Divine Light of the Supreme Soul shines forth from the Guru.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: She who serves the True Guru is forever a happy soul-bride. She is absorbed in the true teachings.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The soul does not die; it does not drown, and it does not swim across.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: This wealth, property and Maya are false. In the end, you must leave these, and depart in sorrow.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Society of the Guru is not obtained like this, by trying to be near or far away.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Without seeing my Guru, sleep does not come.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The seeds of sin and virtue are bound together.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, those who do not walk in the ways of sin, shall be exalted in the world hereafter.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Sin is a stone which does not float.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: As You assign me, so I take to Your service.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Your servant begs to serve those who are enjoined to Your service.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: without selfless service, no one ever receives the fruits of their rewards.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: How rare is that person who understands his own self.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The True Guru has implanted the Truth within me; I dwell steadfastly in Truth and self-restraint.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: One who merges his own self into Him understands, and so becomes pure.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: One who contemplates his own self is truly wise.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When the True Guru is pleased, we find the treasure of the jewel, deep within the self. Without the Guru, no one has found this treasure.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I am a sacrifice to the True Guru. Meeting Him, the supreme status is obtained.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Come, dear sisters - let us join together. I am a sacrifice to the one who tells me of my Beloved.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I am a sacrifice, my soul is a sacrifice, to that True Court of the Beloved Guru.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I am a sacrifice, a sacrifice to You. I meditate on You continually. The village was in ruins, but You have re-populated it. I am a sacrifice to You.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, I am a sacrifice to those who are found to be true in the True Court.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, I am forever a sacrifice to the one who beholds, and inspires others to behold Him.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I am devoted, dedicated, a sacrifice to Your Name.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Like the mad dog running around in all directions, the greedy person, unaware, consumes everything, edible and non-edible alike. Engrossed in the intoxication of sexual desire and anger, people wander through reincarnation over and over again.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Everyone belongs to the One who rules the Universe.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Eat some, and save the rest, if you are destined to return to the world again

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Without You, I have other place of rest at all. Whatever happens is all according to Your Will.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You alone are the True Banker, O Lord; the rest of the world is just Your petty trader.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: One who forgets the Name in this world, shall not find any place of rest anywhere else

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I am a dejected, discarded bride, totally miserable. I have lost my youth; I regret and repent.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: They do not recognize the ultimate reality, that we all must go; they continue to cultivate the poisons of sexual desire and anger.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: True is my place, and True is my seat; I have made Truth my life's purpose

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Why should the created beings feel pride in their minds? The Gift is in the Hands of the Great Giver. As it pleases Him, He may give, or not give. What can be done by the order of the created beings?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I beg of all the Saints, please, give me the merchandise. I offer my prayers - I have forsaken my pride. I am a sacrifice, hundreds of thousands of times a sacrifice, and I pray, please, give me the dust of the feet of the Saints.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Prays Nanak, please hear my prayer, You are the pool, and You are the soul-swan. You are the lotus flower of the day and You are the water-lily of the night. You Yourself behold them, and blossom forth in bliss.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: All praise themselves, and call themselves the greatest of the great. Without the Guru, one's self cannot be known. By merely speaking and listening, what is accomplished?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Through the Guru's Teachings, I praise You; otherwise, I cannot describe Your Value.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: One who is influenced by praise and blame is not God's servant. One who sees the essence of reality with impartial vision, O Saints, is very rare - one among millions.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Serve the True One, and praise the True One.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: praise the True Name, and through the True Name, you will find satisfaction.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Praise the True Guru, who imparts this understanding.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: praise the True Lord; there is none other as great as He is.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The merchants and the traders have come; their profits are pre-ordained. Those who practice Truth reap the profits, abiding in the Will of God. With the Merchandise of Truth, they meet the Guru, who does not have a trace of greed.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those who are pleasing to You meditate on You. They practice the Mantra of the Holy.They themselves swim across, and they save all their ancestors and families as well.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Salvation comes only from the practice of Truth. By adding spices to forbidden foods, they are not made acceptable.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Kings and emperors are under His Power. The whole world is under His Power.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The value of the Creative Power of the Universe cannot be known. Even if its value were known, it could not be described.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He created the Creative Power of the Universe, within which He dwells.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: By His Creative Power, He created the world. Whatever pleases Him, O Nanak - that Command is acceptable.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The extent of Your Command cannot be seen; no one knows how to write it. Even if a hundred poets met together, they could not describe even a tiny bit of it. No one has found Your Value; they all merely write what they have heard again and again.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: As is Your Pleasure, so is Your Will.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: People eat what they believe to be sweet, but it turns out to be bitter in taste. They attach their affections to brothers and friends, uselessly engrossed in corruption. They vanish without a moment's delay; without God's Name, they are stunned and amazed.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Worship the Divine, Supreme Soul, with the intuitive peace and poise of the Guru.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Serving the True Guru, peace is obtained.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Guru cuts away all his bonds; O Servant Nanak, he is absorbed in the poise of intuitive peace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: My thirst is not quenched, and I can find no peace, without the Blessed Vision of the Beloved Saint.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Abandon the tastes of the world, and find intuitive peace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Infinite One is pervading among all. So sleep in peace, and don't worry. He knows everything which happens.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: One who is worthy, becomes a partner with the Guru, and finds a lasting peace forever.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I have easily obtained my Darling Beloved; I am intuitively absorbed in celestial peace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Giver of Peace. Please, take me into Your Embrace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: With no virtue within, how can you find peace?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Through the Guru's Teachings, it is revealed. Meeting with the True One, peace is found.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Meditate on the Name, worship the Name, and through the Name, you shall be absorbed in intuitive peace and poise.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Through selfless service, eternal peace is obtained.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Give up your selfishness, and you shall find peace; like water mingling with water, you shall merge in absorption.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Very auspicious is the coming of those who meet their Beloved and find peace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those who serve the Giver of peace find peace. They enshrine the Guru's Teachings within their minds.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Giver of peace is eternally blissful.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He is the Giver of Peace, the Destroyer of pain. He gives and forgives all beings. He Himself nurtures and cherishes His Creation. I fall at His Feet and surrender to Him.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You are Merciful, the Destroyer of all pain. Please give me Your Ear and listen to my prayer.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those traders who trade in other merchandise, are caught up in the endless waves of the pain of Maya.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When the Husband goes away, the bride suffers in the pain of separation, like the fish in shallow water, crying for mercy.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I do not know of the fisherman, and I do not know of the net. But when the pain comes, then I call upon You.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The color of the world is false and weak; when it washes away, people cry out in pain.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Without true wealth, everyone goes empty-handed; going empty-handed, they suffer in pain.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: With the True Name, pain shall never afflict you.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those who do not understand the nature of sin and virtue are attached to duality; they wander around deluded.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Your All-pervading creative nature cannot be estimated.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When it pleases You, we play music and sing; when it pleases You, we bathe in water.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The True Guru has protected and saved me. O Guru, You are my father. O Guru, You are my mother. O Guru, You are my relative, companion and friend.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: From hand to hand, you are passed around, and your mother says,  This is my son.  O, my thoughtless and foolish mind, think, In the end, nothing shall be yours.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Wondrous is the Form of the Immaculate One. Through the Guru, I have met Him, O my mother! O Siblings of Destiny, make God your Friend.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The One is my Brother, the One is my Friend. The One is my Mother and Father. The One is the Support of the mind; He has given us body and soul. May I never forget God from my mind; He holds all in the Power of His Hands.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: As they came, so shall they go, regretting the mistakes they made.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Wandering around and making mistakes, I climb the plateau; having climbed the plateau, I go up the mountain. But now I have lost my way, and I am wandering around in the forest; without the Guru, I do not understand.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Serve the Guru, the Giver of Peace; He shall wash off the residues of all your mistakes.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Born because of the karma of their past mistakes, they make more mistakes, and fall into mistakes.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Please forgive my past mistakes, O my Dear Lord; now, please place me on the Path.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: This mind is deluded, and goes around the wheel of reincarnation.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: My mind remains immersed in the One Lord; my mind surrenders to Him, and in my mind I meet Him.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: All call themselves Your devotees, but they alone are Your devotees, who are pleasing to Your mind.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The mind is bound by the three dispositions - the three modes of Maya.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Guru's Instruction is the Word, by which the wandering mind is restrained.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: What is that Word, by which the wandering mind can be restrained? What are those teachings, by which we may endure pain and pleasure alike?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: This unstable mind cannot be held steady. Attached to duality, it wanders in the ten directions. It is a poisonous worm, drenched with poison, and in poison it rots away.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O mind, this is the time to plant the seed of the Name.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: With him i lack nothing; the thirsty desires of my mind are satisfied.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The jewel within the mind subdues the mind; attached to the Truth, it is not broken.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The boat of mind crosses over the water, carrying the true merchandise.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Maya is not conquered, and the mind is not subdued

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Listen, you foolish and ignorant mind - only His Will prevails.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O beloved mind, let the Society of the Saints be your dwelling.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Your Mercy is my social status.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: With my palms pressed together, I offer this prayer, please bless me with Your Mercy, and save this sinking stone.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: If it pleases You, then I speak the Truth. If it pleases You, then the True Guru showers His Mercy upon me.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: My intellect is worthless; I am filthy and polluted. Please shower me with Your Mercy sometime.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Yogi rises up and goes out, over and over again. By His Mercy, I have met the Holy Saint.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Showering His Mercy, He has blended me into Himself.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You Yourself are Beautiful, and You Yourself entice the world. You Yourself, by Your Kind Mercy, weave the thread of the world.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: If only He would show His Mercy, and unite me with Himself!

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The invaluable value cannot be obtained; in His Mercy, the Guru bestows it

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Union with the Holy is my wedding date, and separation from the world is my marriage. Says Nanak, Truth is the child born of this Union.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Truth is higher than everything; but higher still is truthful living.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: This speaking and listening is like the song of the wind, for those whose minds are colored by the love of Maya.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Blessed is that land where You dwell, O my Friend and Intimate Divine Guru.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: There are so many places - I have wandered through them all. The masters of wealth and the great land-lords have fallen, crying out,  This is mine! This is mine!  They issue their commands fearlessly, and act in pride. They subdue all under their command, but without the Name, they are reduced to dust.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He could raise dry land from the rivers, and turn the deserts into bottomless oceans. He could appoint a worm as king, and reduce an army to ashes.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: How can I describe the Glories of the Saints? Their knowledge is unfathomable; their limits cannot be known.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Again and again, we hear and tell stories; we read and write and understand loads of knowledge, but still, desires increase day and night, and the disease of egotism fills us with corruption.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Creator has showered His Kindness; He cherishes and nurtures all beings and creatures. He is Merciful, Kind and Compassionate. All are satisfied and fulfilled through Him.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: In their kindness, the Saints have told me of the True One, and so I have obtained all comforts and joy.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: By His Kindness, we are united in His Union.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: True is the Master, and True is His Justice; only the sinners are defeated.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The judgement is in the Hands of the True Guru, who puts an end to the argument. Whatever the Creator does, comes to pass. It cannot be changed by anyone's efforts. Telling lies, they eat dead bodies.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O my companions, sing the Songs of Joy. My desires have been fulfilled, and I shall never again be trapped or shaken by Maya.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: For the sake of it, you journey to sacred shrines and holy rivers; but this priceless jewel is within your own heart.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The veil of illusion has been cut away, and I shall not go out wandering any more.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He Himself is Maya, and He Himself is the Illusion. He Himself has generated emotional attachment throughout the entire universe.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When the time comes to settle their accounts, their red robes are corrupt. His Love is not obtained through hypocrisy. Her false coverings bring only ruin.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The more one feels hunger for other tastes and pleasures, the more this hunger persists.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Praising You, I am never satisfied; such is the hunger I feel for the True Name.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: All my affairs are arranged, and the hunger of my mind is appeased.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The hunger of the hungry is not appeased; by mere words, hunger is not relieved.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The soul-bride is joyously embellished with intuitive ease; her hunger and thirst are taken away.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Modesty, humility and intuitive understanding are my mother-in-law and father-in-law; I have made good deeds my spouse.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Beautiful gates, houses and palaces, solidly built forts, elephants, saddled horses, hundreds of thousands of uncounted armies - none of these will go along with anyone in the end, and yet, the fools bother themselves to exhaustion with these, and then die.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Some have mounted their horses in response, and others are saddling up. Some have tied up their bridles, and others have already ridden off.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You may call yourself good; O Nanak, this will only be known when your honor is approved in God's Account.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The false ones have no social status or honor.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: People die over and over again; they are re-born, and lose their honor. They waste away their lives in vain.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Sustainer of the world. Shower Your Mercy upon Nanak, that he may sing Your Glorious Praises; please, preserve my honor.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Giver of peace of the soul, of life, of honor - as You ordain, I obtain peace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, without the Guru, there is no honor; without honor, no one is carried across.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: True Guru protects and preserves God's honor

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You are the wealth of the poor, the Guru of the guru-less, the honor of the dishonored. I am blind; I have grasped hold of the jewel, the Guru.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: By mere talk, people do not earn passage to Heaven.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The calf loves to suck its mother's milk; its heart blossoms forth upon seeing its mother.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: One whose heart blossoms forth, is not in love with duality.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Nanak seeks the Sanctuary of the One who is the Support of every heart.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: One whose heart is filled with His Infinite Light meets with Him, and shall never again be separated from Him. True is his position; he abides in Truth, with love and affection for the True One.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: In each and every heart, the Unseen is seen.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: No one has found the worth of the ruby of the heart; its value cannot be estimated.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The heart-lotus blossoms forth, and eternal peace is obtained, as one's light merges into the Light.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I have come to recognize the Divine Light within my own heart.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Unto each and every home, into each and every heart, this summons is sent out; the call comes each and every day.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Destroyer of pain, Priceless Treasure, Fearless, free of hate, Unfathomable, Immeasurable, of Undying Form, Unborn, Self-illumined, remembering You in meditation, my mind is filled with a deep and profound peace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He does not need to eat; His Hair is Wondrous and Beautiful; He is free of hate. Millions of people worship His Feet.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: One who remains dead while yet alive obtains the greatest happiness hereafter.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, without the Name, everything is painful, and happiness is forgotten.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: There is no happiness in owning one's own home, in all of Maya, or in lofty mansions casting beautiful shadows. In fraud and greed, this human life is being wasted.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Without the Guru, intuitive wisdom does not come, and the filth of greed does not depart from within.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: That virtuous person who does not walk in the way of greed, and who abides in Truth, is accepted and famous.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: This mind wanders around, driven by greed, totally attached to greed.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You Yourself created all; You Yourself delegate the tasks. You Yourself are pleased, beholding Your Own Glorious Greatness.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: What good is worldly greatness? All the pleasures of Maya are tasteless and insipid. In the end, they shall all fade away.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Guru is the ocean, and all His Teachings are the river. Bathing within it, glorious greatness is obtained.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Gaze upon the glorious greatness of this wealth, and your nights and days will pass, imbued with celestial peace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: There, where greatness, eternal peace and everlasting joy are bestowed, the faces of those whose minds are attuned to the True Name are anointed with the Mark of Grace. If one receives God's Grace, then such honors are received, and not by mere words.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Through goodness and truth, the dead establish a bond with the living. Such are the bonds which prevail in the world.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You are so Great - all Greatness flows from You. You are So Good - Goodness radiates from You. You are True - all that flows from You is True. Nothing at all is false.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You are me, and I am You - what is the difference between us? We are like gold and the bracelet, or water and the waves.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The soul of the man is lured by gold and women; emotional attachment to Maya is so sweet to him.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I may make a cave, in a mountain of gold, or in the water of the nether regions; I may remain standing on my head, upside-down, on the earth or up in the sky; I may totally cover my body with clothes, and wash them continually; I may shout out loud, the white, red, yellow and black Vedas; I may even live in dirt and filth. And yet, all this is just a product of evil-mindedness, and intellectual corruption. I was not, I am not, and I will never be anything at all!

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The jewel emerged from the water, when the mountain of gold was used to churn it.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: This spiritual wisdom of God, the Supreme Soul, has illuminated my being.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: God transmutes rusted iron into gold

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Pride in social status is empty; pride in personal glory is useless.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Only You Yourself know Your Glory. You Yourself recognize Your Own Self. I am a sacrifice to Your Saints, who have crushed their sexual desire, anger and greed.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: This is the time to speak and sing the Praise and the Glory of God, which brings the merit of millions of cleansing and purifying baths. The tongue which chants these Praises is worthy; there is no charity equal to this.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: All strict rituals are just clever contrivances. My God knows everything. He has made His Glory manifest, and all people celebrate Him.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: God is Wise, Giving, Tender-hearted, Pure, Beautiful and Infinite. He is our Companion and Helper, Supremely Great, Lofty and Utterly Infinite. He is not known as young or old; His Court is Steady and Stable. Whatever we seek from Him, we receive. He is the Support of the unsupported.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: God has produced everything in great abundance. Granting His Grace, God has satisfied all. Bless us with Your Gifts, O my Great Giver. All beings and creatures are satisfied.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Everyone cries out,  More! More! , with the idea of receiving. How great should we call the Giver? His Gifts are beyond estimation. O Nanak, there is no deficiency; Your Storehouses are filled to overflowing, age after age.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Honor is obtained by eating this tasty dish; of all gifts, this is the greatest gift.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Your Gifts continue to increase. Nanak begs for that gift which is pleasing to You.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I offer my mind to those friends, who have met the Guru and found God.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The One, the Guru, who is sought by all - only a few, by great good fortune, receive His Darshan. His Place is lofty, infinite and unfathomable; the Guru has shown me that palace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Our comings and goings have ended, and through great good fortune, O Nanak, our hopes are fulfilled.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Praises of the True One are obtained by great good fortune.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those who are blessed with great good fortune obtain the dust of the feet of the humble.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: By great good fortune, I have obtained the Blessed Vision of the Guru's Darshan.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Guru is All-powerful, the Guru is Infinite. By great good fortune, the Blessed Vision of His Darshan is obtained. The Guru is Imperceptible, Immaculate and Pure. There is no other as great as the Guru. The Guru is the Creator, the Guru is the Doer.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: By great good fortune, I meet my God, and then all pain of separation departs.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Granting forgiveness, the Perfect Guru unites us with the Creator.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Some are forgiven, and merge with You; through the Guru's Teachings, we are joined to You.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Stand and offer your prayer, to the One who cannot be moved by force.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: With relish and delight, you continually bite at the bait; you are trapped, you fool - how will you ever escape?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He transformed me, the fool, into a fine speaker, and He made the unconscious become conscious; by His Grace, I have obtained the nine treasures. May I never forget that God from my mind.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I am just a fool, Lord; I place my hopes in You!

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I have done this, and I will do that  - I am an idiotic fool for saying this! I have forgotten the Doer of all; I am caught in the love of duality. There is no pain as great as the pain of Maya; it drives people to wander all around the world, until they become exhausted.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: With each breath and morsel of food, do not forget the Guru, the Embodiment of Fulfillment. None is seen to be as great as the Guru. Meditate on Him twenty-four hours a day. As He casts His Glance of Grace, we obtain the True Name, the Treasure of Excellence.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He came and he went, and now, even his name has died. After he left, food was offered on leaves, and the birds were called to come and eat.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: If I could live for millions and millions of years, and if the air was my food and drink, and if I lived in a cave and never saw either the sun or the moon, and if I never slept, even in dreams - even so, I could not estimate Your Value. How can I describe the Greatness of Your Name?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: As it is pre-ordained, people speak their words. As it is pre-ordained, they consume their food. As it is pre-ordained, they walk along the way. As it is pre-ordained, they see and hear. As it is pre-ordained, they draw their breath. Why should I go and ask the scholars about this?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The wife yearns for gold and silver, and her friends, the senses, yearn for good food.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The True Food is the Love of the Lord; the True Guru has spoken. With this True Food, I am satisfied, and with the Truth, I am delighted.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Meeting with the Guru, peace is found. The fire is extinguished in His Glorious Praises.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Seeing this world on fire, I rushed to the Sanctuary of the True Guru.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When pieces of bronze or gold or iron break, the metal-smith welds them together again in the fire, and the bond is established.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: God's inner nature is like that of fire, untouched and forever immaculate.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: without his command Your hands and feet will fall off in an instant, when you are burnt in the fire.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: If I dressed myself in fire, and built my house of snow, and made iron my food; and if I were to drink in all pain like water, and drive the entire earth before me.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Rare are those who are blessed with Fear of God Boat.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: In fear we are born, and in fear we die. Fear is always present in the mind.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those who do not have the Fear of God, are overtaken by fear. They are destroyed by their own pride. Having forgotten the Name, the world is roaming around like a wild demon.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: If the mind becomes balanced and detached, and comes to dwell in its own true home, imbued with the Fear of God, then it enjoys the essence of supreme spiritual wisdom; it shall never feel hunger again.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: In His Sanctuary, there is no fear or sorrow. Without Him, nothing at all can be done. I have renounced clever tricks, power and intellectual corruption.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I searched and searched, and found God. In the Fear of God, I have been united in His Union.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The ointment of spiritual wisdom is the destroyer of fear; through love, the Pure One is seen.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The True Guru has led me to meet Him, and now I dwell in the Fear of God. O Nanak, His Love is always with me.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: let the Fear of God be the boat to carry your soul across.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Be afraid, if you have any fear, other than the Fear of God. Afraid of fear, and living in fear, the mind is held in tumult.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: What sort of fear is that, which frightens other fears?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Place the Fear of God within the home of your heart; with this Fear of God in your heart, all other fears shall be frightened away.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Without the Fear of God, all that is fashioned is false. Useless is the mold, and useless are the hammer-strokes on the mold.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Fear of God is overpowering, and so very heavy, while the intellect is lightweight, as is the speech one speaks.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: CREATIVE BEING PERSONIFIED. NO FEAR. NO HATRED.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The king is seated upon the throne, imbued with the Fear of God and the five qualities.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He alone is known to be insane, when he goes insane with the Fear of God

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, if you die without the fear of God, you will arise and depart with a blackened face.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Without the fear of God, you may live very, very long, and savor the most enjoyable pleasures.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, if one dies in the fear of God, his coming into the world is blessed and approved.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The false are ruined by falsehood.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: No one succeeds through falsehood.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O woman, the false ones are being cheated by falsehood. God is your Husband; He is Handsome and True. He is obtained by reflecting upon the Guru.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Baba, other wisdom is useless and irrelevant. If falsehood is practiced a hundred times, it is still false in its effects.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Some are stuck in falsehood, and false are the rewards they receive.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Greed is a dog; falsehood is a filthy street-sweeper.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Through the love with duality, no one has found peace. They write falsehood, and they practice falsehood; they are burnt to ashes by focusing their consciousness on falsehood.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Without the True One, all are false, and all practice falsehood.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The filth of fraud and falsehood does not stick to those who, by Guru's Grace, remain awake and aware, night and day.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, from false talk, only falsehood is obtained.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Practicing falsehood again and again, people come and go in reincarnation, and forfeit their honor.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: If the individual soul has faith in the Supreme Soul, then it shall obtain realization within its own home.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When the Great Merchant shows His Mercy, He blends us into Himself. Says Nanak, place your faith in the Guru.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I remember Him in meditation with every breath and morsel of food, with perfect faith. How could I forget Him from my mind? How could I forget Him from my mind, even for an instant? He is the Most Worthy; He is my very life!

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, He is everlasting wealth. Place your mind's faith in Him, and you shall find peace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: What sort of a resting place is this world? Doing deeds of faith, pack up the supplies for your journey, and remain committed to the Name.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: They close their eyes and begin to dream. Rising up again, they engage in conflicts; they set the stage as if they will live for 100 years.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I wash the feet of those who walk upon Your Path. With my eyes, I long to behold those kind people.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, the True One who takes away the eyes of spiritual wisdom - He alone can restore them.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: With the mind caught up in playful pleasures, involved in all sorts of amusements and sights that stagger the eyes, people are led astray. The emperors sitting on their thrones are consumed by anxiety.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Guru has applied the true ointment of spiritual wisdom to my eyes.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The eyes are not satisfied by seeing - each organ seeks out one sensory quality.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: To see without eyes; to hear without ears; to walk without feet; to work without hands; to speak without a tongue - like this, one remains dead while yet alive.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Without him , before your very eyes, you shall be torn apart.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: One who meets with the Holy True Guru finds the Treasure of Excellence.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Remember, remember, remember Him in meditation; He is the treasure of excellence.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Serving the True Guru, I have found the Treasure of Excellence. Its value cannot be estimated.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Creator has passed judgement, and the evil-doers have been silenced and killed.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I have not died - that evil nature within me has died.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: With the mind encircled by wickedness and evil, people do evil deeds.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Know this well, that one who eats and eats while practicing evil, is like a field of poisonous plants.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: That which is for his own good, he thinks is evil.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Gathering the wealth of Maya, you earn an evil reputation. Those whom you work to please shall pass away along with you.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The soul-bride is of no use at all, if she is evil and without virtue. She does not find peace in this world or the next; she burns in falsehood and corruption.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The strife of this world is evil; these struggles are consuming it.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: One thinks that good and bad deeds come from himself; this is the source of all evil.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Later, you will regret and repent - you fool! Why are you engrossed in evil-mindedness and skepticism?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Heat up the sun energy of the right nostril, and cool down the moon energy of the left nostril; practicing this breath-control, bring them into perfect balance.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When it pleases You, we wield the sword, and cut off the heads of our enemies. When it pleases You, we go out to foreign lands; hearing news of home, we come back again.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You are entangled in association with your enemies, and the enjoyment of pleasures; your soul is burning up with them

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, he is a brave warrior, who conquers and subdues his vicious inner ego.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Serving the Guru, I have found eternal peace; my ego has been silenced and subdued.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Rust does not stick to those who burn their ego.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You do not distinguish between good and evil, O my merchant friend - your mind is intoxicated with ego.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The sickness of my ego has been dispelled, and my pain is over and done.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Whoever comes into the world and indulges in ego, must depart.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He is not obtained by mouthing mere words, but by rooting out ego from within. Meeting the True Guru, one is permeated forever with the Fear of God, who Himself comes to dwell within the mind.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When the Divine Light dawns, ego and selfishness are dispelled.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: As they plant, so do they harvest. They shall not obtain peace, even in their dreams.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: In their dreams at night, people wander around as long as they sleep; just so, they are under the power of the snake Maya, as long as their hearts are filled with ego and duality.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Everything is within the home of the self; there is nothing beyond. One who searches outside is deluded by doubt.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those who take pleasure in God's Will remove doubt from within.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Emotional attachment to Maya is created by my God; He Himself misleads us through illusion and doubt.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Baba, Maya deceives with its illusion. Deceived by doubt, the discarded bride is not received into the Lap of her Beloved.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Suffering and doubt are cut out from within, and peace is obtained.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He cannot be understood by reading scriptures; the deceitful pretenders are deluded by doubt.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When good karma dawns, the wall of doubt is torn down.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: In this world of her parents' home, the soul-bride has been deluded by doubt. Attached to duality, she later comes to regret it. She forfeits both this world and the next, and even in her dreams, she does not find peace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Through doubt, the people are being destroyed.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: With Guru the egg of doubt has burst; my mind has been enlightened

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Father, I am unfortunate, a fraud. I have not found Your Name; my mind is blind and deluded by doubt.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: By the Fear of the True Guru, doubt and fear are dispelled. Imbued with His Fear, we are absorbed in the Love of the True One.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Practicing hypocrisy and attaching your mind to worldly objects, your doubt shall never depart.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The dogs of greed are with me. In the early morning, they continually bark at the wind. Falsehood is my dagger; through deception, I eat the carcasses of the dead. I live as a wild hunter, O Creator!

author: Granth Sahib
quote: If someone understands both the disease and the medicine, only then is he a wise physician.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You may practice chanting, penance and austere self-discipline within your mind, but without the Name, life is useless.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Make Truth your self-discipline, and make good deeds the lines you draw; make chanting the Name your cleansing bath.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: They chant and meditate, practicing austere self-discipline for years and years; they wander on journeys all over the earth; and yet, their hearts are not at peace, even for an instant.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The merits of pilgrimages, fasts and hundreds of thousands of techniques of austere self-discipline are found in the dust of the feet of the Holy.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When chanting, austere meditation and self-discipline become your protectors, then the lotus blossoms forth, and the honey trickles out.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Without the True Guru, understanding is not obtained. Meditation, penance and austere self-discipline are found by surrendering to the True Guru's Will.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Siblings of Destiny, become the dust of the feet of the humble Saints. In the Society of the Saints, the Guru is found. He is the Treasure of Liberation, the Source of all good fortune.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Call permanent only the One, who does not have destiny inscribed upon His Forehead. The sky and the earth shall pass away; He alone is permanent.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: One meets the Holy Saint only through perfect destiny.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You are the Giver, You are the Architect of Destiny. You are All-powerful, the Giver of Eternal Peace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Boat of the Guru is found by His Grace; O Nanak, such blessed destiny is pre-ordained.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The True Guru is the Giver of all things; through perfect destiny, He is met.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Enjoy yourselves and eat, O Siblings of Destiny. In the Guru's Court, He has blessed me with the Robe of Honor.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Siblings of Destiny, the terrifying world-ocean is so difficult to cross - I am terrified!

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, God's Flavor is sweet to the minds and bodies of those who have such blessed destiny written on their foreheads.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Siblings of Destiny, filth is washed away by bathing in the Pure Water of the Name.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Siblings of Destiny, the nine treasures are found in the Home of the Lord; He comes to meet those who deserve it by their past actions.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Without destiny, the True Guru is not found, even though He sits within the home of our own inner being, always near and close at hand. There is ignorance within, and the pain of doubt, like a separating screen.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Siblings of Destiny, it is received only when God Himself bestows it.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Meet with the humble Saints, O Siblings of Destiny, and contemplate the True Name. For the journey of the soul, gather those supplies which will go with you here and hereafter. These are obtained from the Perfect Guru, when God bestows His Glance of Grace. Those unto whom He is Merciful, receive His Grace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: All the rewards which the mind desires are with the True Guru. One whose destiny is so pre-ordained, obtains the Wealth of the True Name.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Greatness is in the Hands of the Creator; it is obtained by pre-ordained destiny.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Siblings of Destiny, those who lack devotion - why have they even bothered to come into the world? They do not serve the Perfect Guru; they waste away their lives in vain.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Everyone, all over the world, longs for the True Guru. Without the good fortune of destiny, the Blessed Vision of His Darshan is not obtained.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: By perfect good fortune, one meets the True Guru, when one's destiny is awakened.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, He is obtained by those, upon whose faces and foreheads such pre-recorded destiny is written.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The key is in the hands of the True Guru; no one else can open this door. By perfect destiny, He is met.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: As you plant, so shall you harvest; your destiny is recorded on your forehead.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I have enjoyed the tastes, and now my pains have come to fruition; such is my pre-ordained destiny, O my mother

author: Granth Sahib
quote: All serve the One True Lord; through pre-ordained destiny, they meet Him.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Siblings of Destiny, let none think that they have any power.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Siblings of Destiny, without the Guru, there is no devotional worship. Without the Guru, devotion is not obtained, even though everyone may long for it.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Subduing their desires, they merge with the True One; they see in their minds that everyone comes and goes in reincarnation.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Consumed by desire, they have no understanding at all. They purchase poison, and they are thirsty with their fascination for poison. Telling lies, they eat poison.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Renouncing desire, I have found intuitive peace and poise; I have enshrined the One within my mind.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The tongue is asleep, in its desire for sweet flavors. The mind is asleep, fascinated by Maya.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Another person on silence sits alone, but his heart is tied in knots of desire.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The waves of desire in the world-ocean are intoxicating wine.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The desert is not satisfied by rain, and the fire is not quenched by desire. The king is not satisfied with his kingdom, and the oceans are full, but still they thirst for more. O Nanak, how many times must I seek and ask for the True Name? |

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Through self-realization, people dwell within the home of their inner being; egotism and desire depart.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The desire for the worldly drama arises in the intellect, but even with thousands of clever mental tricks, the heat of the Fear of God does not come into play.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The fire of desire is deep within; unsatisfied, people remain hungry and thirsty.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Sexual desires are so strong and compelling; where has this sexual desire come from?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Why, O soul, do you try such clever tricks? Taking away and giving back, God does not delay.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Not a moment or an instant's delay is permitted, when one's measure of life is full. By Guru's Grace, one comes to know the True One, and is absorbed into Him.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: If someone tells him the truth, he looks upon that as poison. He cannot tell victory from defeat. This is the way of life in the world of the faithless cynic.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: By falsehood and deception, none have found Him. Whatever you plant, you shall eat.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The love of Maya makes this mind dance, and the deceit within makes people suffer in pain.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: My forehead has been branded with His brand; I owe such a great debt to the Guru. He has been so generous and kind to me; He has carried me across the treacherous and terrifying world-ocean.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Some do not think of death; they entertain great hopes. They die, and are re-born, and die, over and over again. They are of no use at all! In their conscious minds, they call themselves good.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Asleep in the darkness of the night, how shall she pass her life-night without her Husband? Her limbs shall burn, her body shall burn, and her mind and wealth shall burn as well.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Attachment to Maya is an ocean of darkness; neither this shore nor the one beyond can be seen.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: My mind has entered their Sanctuary. I have renounced my pride in my own strength, and the darkness of emotional attachment.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Through the Guru's Teachings, the darkness has been dispelled, and the heavy doors have been opened.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: One who does not fear God shall live in fear; without the Guru, there is only pitch darkness.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Guru has lit the brilliant light of spiritual wisdom, and the darkness of ignorance has been dispelled.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Like a lamp lit in the darkness, the spiritual wisdom of the Guru dispels ignorance.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Like a boat in the ocean of fear; like a lamp which illumines the darkness; like fire which takes away the pain of cold - just so, chanting the Name, the mind becomes peaceful.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The darkness of ignorance has been dispelled, and my mind has been awakened; within the home of my inner being, I have found the genuine article.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Divine Light shines in their hearts who have good destiny, and like the sun which removes the darkness of night, it dispels the darkness of ignorance.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Engrossed in egotism, the world perishes. Without the Guru, there is utter darkness. In emotional attachment to Maya, they have forgotten the Great Giver, the Giver of Peace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I have searched in vain, and I am so confused; in this darkness, I cannot find the path. In egotism, they cry out in pain. Says Nanak, how will they be saved?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The foolish intellectuals are forever in spiritual darkness.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: What can the cold do to the fire? How can the night affect the sun? What can the darkness do to the moon? What can social status do to air and water? What are personal possessions to the earth, from which all things are produced?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The four sources of creation are Yours; the spoken word is Yours.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You created the world, and assigned tasks to one and all. You watch over Your Creation, and through Your All-powerful Creative Potency, You cast the dice.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You do not know the One who created the creation.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Deep within the self is the Light of God; It radiates throughout the expanse of His creation.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The creation is subject to the Creator, who sustains it by His Almighty Power.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The earth is Your servant, a slave at Your Feet. In the four sources of creation, and in all speech, You dwell. You are dear to the minds of all.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Nothing of the color and the form of the creation shall remain; the entire expanse is transitory.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Give up the pleasures of corruption, or else you will surely die of them.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The virtuous obtain Truth; they give up their desires for evil and corruption.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The pleasures of corruption are false. All that is seen shall turn to ashes.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The conscious mind is awake only to falsehood, corruption and attachment. It gathers in the assets of sin and greed.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Intuitive peace and poise, contentment, enduring satisfaction and bliss come through the Pleasure of the Master's Will.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Let wisdom be your mother, and contentment your father. Let Truth be your brother - these are your best relatives.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those who meditate on the Name, with one-pointed mind and focused consciousness, remain forever stable in the world.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: According to this inscription, gifts, light and glorious greatness are received. Joining with Maya, the spiritual consciousness is lost.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The thirst of your mind shall be quenched, and all hopes shall be fulfilled. Your consciousness shall not waver.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The consciousness of the wicked, faithless cynics wanders around in search of transitory wealth, unstable and distracted. Searching outside of themselves, they are ruined; the object of their search is in that sacred place within the home of the heart.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He draws us to His Touchstone, to test our love and consciousness. The counterfeit have no place there, but the genuine are placed in His Treasury.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those who focus their consciousness on the True Guru are perfectly fulfilled and famous.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O my mind, focus your consciousness on the One. Without the One, all entanglements are worthless; emotional attachment to Maya is totally false.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I serve my True Guru with single-minded devotion, and lovingly focus my consciousness on Him. The True Guru is the mind's desire and the sacred shrine of pilgrimage, for those unto whom He has given this understanding. The blessings of the wishes of the mind are obtained, and the fruits of one's desires.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: By Guru's Grace, a few come to understand; they center their consciousness in the fourth state.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When one's light merges into the Light, and one's intuitive consciousness is joined with the Intuitive Consciousness, then one's cruel and violent instincts and egotism depart, and skepticism and sorrow are taken away.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those who suck the blood of human beings - how can their consciousness be pure?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: In the third watch of the night, O my merchant friend, your consciousness is focused on wealth and youth.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When the mind accepts, and is satisfied with the One, then the consciousness becomes steady and stable. Then, one's food is the True Name, one's garments are the True Name, and one's Support, O Nanak, is the True Name.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Let sincere faith be your bowing in prayer, and let the conquest of your mind be your objective in life.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I serve my True Guru, and meditate on Him all day and night. Renouncing selfishness and conceit, I seek His Sanctuary, and speak sweet words to Him.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When selfishness and conceit are eradicated from within, then there is no attachment to Maya.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I am egotistical and conceited, and my intellect is ignorant. Meeting the Guru, my selfishness and conceit have been abolished. The illness of egotism is gone, and I have found peace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Practicing egotism, selfishness and conceit, she wanders around the world, but her wealth and property will not go with her.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The eyes which look upon corruption do not know the Love and the Fear of God. Conquering self-conceit, one obtains the Name.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O mind, don't cry out that you are hungry, always hungry; stop complaining. The One who created the 8.4 million species of beings gives sustenance to all.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Wind and water have patience and tolerance; the earth has compassion and forgiveness

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Nanak, it is absurd to ask to be spared from pain by begging for comfort.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Your humble servants remain satisfied and fulfilled, and the True Guru blesses them with encouragement and comfort.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Of all comforts, this is the true comfort. Keep the Guru's Teachings in your mind.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Tell your troubles to the One who is the Source of all comfort.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He(God) gave all beings souls, bodies, mouths, noses and water to drink. He gave them corn to eat, clothes to wear, and other pleasures to enjoy. But they do not remember the One who gave them all this. The animals think that they made themselves!

author: Granth Sahib
quote: If one's clothes are stained with blood, the garment becomes polluted.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Turkish horses, gold, silver and loads of gorgeous clothes - none of these shall go with you, O Nanak. They are lost and left behind, you fool!

author: Granth Sahib
quote: People are entangled in the enjoyment of fine clothes, but gold and silver are only dust. They acquire beautiful horses and elephants, and ornate carriages of many kinds. They think of nothing else, and they forget all their relatives. They ignore their Creator; without the Name, they are impure.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I am a slave, purchased in Your market; what clever tricks do I have?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Nanak seeks the company of the lowest of the low class, the very lowest of the low. Why should he try to compete with the great? In that place where the lowly are cared for - there, the Blessings of Your Glance of Grace rain down.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: What good is social class and status? Truthfulness is measured within. Pride in one's status is like poison - holding it in your hand and eating it, you shall die.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Cheating is eating a rotting carcass.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Those who charm scorpions and handle snakes only brand themselves with their own hands.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: No one is saved by mere talk and speech, nor by reading loads of books.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: No one can know His Value; no one can weigh it. He dwells deep within the mind and body.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Without the merchandise of the Name, the house of the body and the store of the mind are empty. Meeting the Guru, the hard and heavy doors are opened.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The empty body is dreadful, when the soul goes out from within. The burning fire of life is extinguished, and the smoke of the breath no longer emerges. The five relatives (the senses) weep and wail painfully, and waste away through the love of duality.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Body and soul, all belong to Him. He gives His Support to all.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I have searched my mind and body, through and through. How can I meet my Darling Beloved, O my mother?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You bless everyone. Please bring my life to fulfillment. The body-temple is sanctified by the Blessed Vision of Your Darshan, and thus, the impregnable fort of the soul is conquered.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Search your body and mind, and find the Name. Restrain your wandering mind, and keep it in check.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The body is a furnace, and the mind is the iron within it; the five fires are heating it.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The union of the mother and father brings the body into being.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: This mind and body are so imbued, and this tongue is dyed in the deep crimson color of the poppy. Through the Love and the Fear of God, we are dyed in this color.

author: Granth Sahib
