quote: For me, there is no other like You. By Your Glance of Grace, my body is blessed and sanctified.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Her body and her status shall not go with her to the world hereafter. Where she is called to answer for her account, there, she shall be emancipated only by true actions.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Master Himself bestows honor. He creates and bestows body and soul. He Himself preserves the honor of His servants; He places both His Hands upon their foreheads.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I have become the Master of my body-village; I have taken the five rivals as prisoners.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The whole world is a store-house of lamp-black; the body and mind are blackened with it.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When the body falls, the play of life is over; what shall be the condition of the evil-doers then?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The inner being is empty without love. The body shall crumble into a heap of ashes.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: This mind, body and wealth were given by God, who naturally adorns us. He has blessed us with all our energy, and infused His Infinite Light deep within us. Forever and ever, meditate in remembrance on God; keep Him enshrined in your heart.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Seeing Him, our evil inclinations vanish; mind and body become peaceful and tranquil.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: With your tongue, repeat the True Name, and your mind and body shall become pure. Your mother and father and all your relations - without Him, there are none at all.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: For His sake, you assumed this body; see God always with you. God is pervading the water, the land and the sky; He sees all with His Glance of Grace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You are not conscious of God, and your body shall be cast into the wilderness. Focus your consciousness on the True Guru; you shall enjoy bliss forever and ever.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Arising each day, you cherish your body, but you are idiotic, ignorant and without understanding.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Filth does not stick to the body of one who has secured a dwelling in his True Home.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: As long as the soul-companion is with the body, it dwells in happiness. But when the companion arises and departs, then the body-bride mingles with dust.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The wall of the body is temporary, as is the soul-mason within it. The flavor of the intellect is bland and insipid without the Salt. O Nanak, as He wills, He makes things right. Without the Name, no one is approved.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The defect of the body which leads to sin is the mud puddle, and this mind is the frog, which does not appreciate the lotus flower at all.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: My mind and body are afflicted with the pain of separation from the Guru.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Within my mind and body is the intense pain of separation; how can my Beloved come to meet me in my home?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: My breath of life is in Your Power, God; my soul and body are totally Yours.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: My mind and body have been cooled and soothed; I have been blessed with patience and composure.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O Baba, the pleasures of other foods are false. Eating them, the body is ruined, and wickedness and corruption enter into the mind.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Without the Name, the body suffers in pain; it crumbles like a wall of sand.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: If the mind is polluted, then the body is polluted, and the tongue is polluted as well.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O body, you are living in a dream! What good deeds have you done? When I stole something by deception, then my mind was pleased.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: By good destiny, this union comes about; this body enjoys its pleasures. Those who have lost their destiny, suffer separation from this union.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Destiny has brought together and united the body and the soul-swan. He who created them, also separates them.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Twenty-four hours a day, destroy the eight things, and in the ninth place, conquer the body.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Within this body are the two brothers, sin and virtue. When the two joined together, the Universe was produced. Subduing both, and entering into the Home of the One, through the Guru's Teachings, we are absorbed in intuitive peace.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Within the cave of this body, there is one beautiful place.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: On that day when the body perishes - at that time, she becomes a ghost.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: If my body were afflicted with pain, under the evil influence of unlucky stars; and if the blood-sucking kings were to hold power over me - even if this were my condition, I would still worship and adore You, and my longing to chant Your Praises would not decrease.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Someone may practice intensive meditation, and discipline his body, but his mind still runs around in ten directions

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Why should we speak of any other? As long as Your Light is within the body, You speak through that Light. Without Your Light, who can do anything? Show me any such cleverness!

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He placed the soul in the body which He had fashioned. He protects the Creation which He has created. With their eyes, they see, and with their tongues, they speak; with their ears, they bring the mind to awareness. With their feet, they walk, and with their hands, they work; they wear and eat whatever is given.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: giving one's head, one is emancipated, and the mind and body become true.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: My body is pierced through with the arrow of love. How can any physician know the cure?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The temple is being demolished; the body is being plundered, and the soul-bride, left all alone, is captured.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: God has erected the temple of the body; He has placed the nine doors, and the soul-bride sits within. She enjoys the sweet play again and again, while the five demons are plundering her.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: O body, I have seen you blowing away like dust on the earth.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: With your nectar-like body, you live in comfort, but this world is just a passing drama. You practice greed, avarice and great falsehood, and you carry such a heavy burden.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: True are the Teachings of the True Guru. The body and mind are cooled and soothed, by the touchstone of Truth. This is the true mark of wisdom, that one remains detached, like the water-lily, or the lotus upon the water.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The body is wild, and the mind is foolish. Practicing egotism, selfishness and conceit, your life is passing away.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: One who takes pride in himself shall never be right. The soul and body are all at Your disposal.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Let contentment be your father; the Guru is the Primal Being, beyond birth or incarnation.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Sublime is their birth, and the place where they dwell.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: My Friend, the True Guru, has been my Best Friend since I was very young. I cannot survive without seeing Him, O my mother!

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Offer your most sincere prayers to the True Guru, so that He may unite you with your Best Friend.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You are my Companion; You are my Best Friend. You are my Beloved; I am in love with You. You are my honor; You are my decoration. Without You, I cannot survive, even for an instant.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: That which is true, you believe to be untrue; what is transitory, you believe to be permanent

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The husband is delighted seeing his sons, and his wife upon his bed. He applies sandalwood and scented oils, and dresses himself in his beautiful clothes. But dust shall mix with dust, and he shall depart, leaving hearth and home behind.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You may have horses as fast as the wind, elephants to ride on, sandalwood oil, and beautiful women in bed, actors in dramas, singing in theaters - but even with them, the mind does not find contentment.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: If the floor of this palace was a mosaic of diamonds and rubies, and if my bed was encased with rubies, and if heavenly beauties, their faces adorned with emeralds, tried to entice me with sensual gestures of love - seeing these, I might go astray and forget You, and Your Name would not enter into my mind.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You are wasting this life in the pride of wealth and the splendor of beauty.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The eyes are asleep in corruption, gazing upon the beauty of another. The ears are asleep, listening to slanderous stories.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Wealth, the beauty of youth and flowers are guests for only a few days. Like the leaves of the water-lily, they wither and fade and finally die.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The mind's pleasures of love and beauty bring just as many blames and sins

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I have seen God, fearless, of wondrous beauty; my mind shall never leave Him to go anywhere else.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Into this blind clay, You have infused awareness. Everything, everywhere which You have given is good.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: There is one awareness among all created beings. None have been created without this awareness.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The body is dust; the wind speaks through it. Understand, O wise one, who has died. Awareness, conflict and ego have died, but the One who sees does not die.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: True is His Empire, and True is His Command. True is His Seat of True Authority. True is the Creative Power which He has created. True is the world which He has fashioned. O Nanak, chant the True Name; I am forever and ever a sacrifice to Him.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The world is burning in the fire of desire, in greed, arrogance and excessive ego.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: If I were to become an emperor and raise a huge army, and sit on a throne, issuing commands and collecting taxes - O Nanak, all of this could pass away like a puff of wind. Seeing these, I might go astray and forget You, and Your Name would not enter into my mind.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: When I dwell upon Him in my soul, all my sorrows depart. The sickness of anxiety and the disease of ego are cured; He Himself cherishes me.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: You are my Protector everywhere; why should I feel any fear or anxiety?

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Sin is the charcoal placed upon it, which burns the mind; the tongs are anxiety and worry.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: I took the form of so many plants and trees, and so many animals. Many times I entered the families of snakes and flying birds.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The conscious mind is engrossed in sexual desire, anger and Maya.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The Guru has cut out the sinful mistakes of sexual desire and anger, and my hopes have been fulfilled.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The body-village is filled to overflowing with sexual desire and anger, which were broken into bits when I met with the Holy Saint. By pre-ordained destiny, I have met with the Guru.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Do not meet with, or even approach those people, whose hearts are filled with horrible anger.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Cruelty, material attachment, greed and anger are the four rivers of fire. Falling into them, one is burned, O Nanak! One is saved only by holding tight to good deeds.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Sexual desire and anger are diffused throughout the universe. Coming and going, people suffer in pain.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: The world is drunk, engrossed in sexual desire, anger and egotism. Seek the Sanctuary of the Saints, and fall at their feet; your suffering and darkness shall be removed.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Through the Kind and Compassionate True Guru, I have met the Lord; I have conquered sexual desire, anger and greed.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Sexual desire and anger shall not seduce you, and the dog of greed shall depart.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Renounce sexual desire, anger, falsehood and slander; forsake Maya and eliminate egotistical pride.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: In age after age, through all the ages, forever and ever, those who belong to the Guru's Family shall prosper and increase.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: At the age of ten, he is a child; at twenty, a youth, and at thirty, he is called handsome. At forty, he is full of life; at fifty, his foot slips, and at sixty, old age is upon him. At seventy, he loses his intellect, and at eighty, he cannot perform his duties. At ninety, he lies in his bed, and he cannot understand his weakness. After seeking and searching for such a long time, O Nanak, I have seen that the world is just a mansion of smoke.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Faith in Him has welled up within my mind. Nanak gives this advice.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: This opportunity shall not come again! I say to you, O my body, listen to my advice! You slander, and then praise others; you indulge in lies and gossip. You gaze upon the wives of others, O my soul; you steal and commit evil deeds.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Listen - listen to my advice! Only the good deeds which you have done shall remain with you, O my soul.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: He seeks no advice when He builds; He seeks no advice when He destroys. He seeks no advice while giving or taking. He alone knows His Creative Power; He Himself does all deeds. He beholds all in His Vision. He gives to those with whom He is pleased.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Whatever pleases You is a pure action of karma.

author: Granth Sahib
quote: Serve the True Guru fearlessly, and your doubt shall be dispelled.

author: Huseyin Sahin
quote: She was brought to hospital with respiration problems very late.

author: Huseyin Sahin
quote: She was brought to hospital with respiration problems very late. We immediately began treatment for bird flu since she had contacted fowl, but her condition has become grave and we lost her today.

author: Huseyin Sahin
quote: Tests conducted by one of the doctors at our establishment determined that the six patients suffered from pulmonary infections, from pneumonia.

author: Huseyin Sahin
quote: It can't be known whether the disease is bird flu or not before the test result is announced in Ankara.

author: Huseyin Sahin
quote: Fifteen of them are in bed, one in a critical condition and eight are able to move about. Most of the patients are children.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: More wisdom is latent in things as they are than in all the words men use.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Only he can understand what a farm is, what a country is, who shall have sacrificed part of himself to his farm or country, fought to save it, struggled to make it beautiful. Only then will the love of farm or country fill his heart.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Perfection is finally attained not when there is no longer anything to add but when there is no longer anything to take away, when a body has been stripped down to its nakedness.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Mad is the man who is forever gritting his teeth against that granite block, complete and changeless, of the past

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: True love begins when nothing is looked for in return.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Sorrow is one of the vibrations that prove the fact of living

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: What do we mean by setting a man free? You cannot free a man who dwells in a desert and is an unfeeling brute. There is no liberty except the liberty of some one making his way towards something. Such a man can be set free if you will teach him the meaning of thirst, and how to trace a path to a well. Only then will he embark upon a course of action that will not be without significance. You could not liberate a stone if there were no law of gravity -- for where will the stone go, once it is quarried?

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people together to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: A pile of rocks ceases to be a rock when somebody contemplates it with the idea of a cathedral in mind.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: We say nothing essential about the cathedral when we speak of its stones. We say nothing essential about Man when we seek to define him by the qualities of men.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: When you give yourself, you receive more than you give.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: For true love is inexhaustible; the more you give, the more you have. And if you go to draw at the true fountainhead, the more water you draw, the more abundant is its flow.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: To be a man is, precisely, to be responsible.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: And now here is my secret, a very simple secret; it is only with the heart that one can see rightly, what is essential is invisible to the eye.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Grown-ups never understand anything by themselves, and it is tiresome for children to be always and forever explaining things to them.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: You become responsible, forever, for what you have tamed.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: 'Men have forgotten this truth,' said the fox. 'But you must not forget it. You become responsible, forever, for what you have tamed.'

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Love does not consist in gazing at each other but in looking together in the same direction.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Grown-ups never understand anything for themselves, and it is tiresome for children to be always and forever explaining things to them.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Life has taught us that love does not consist in gazing at each other but in looking outward together in the same direction.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: To be a man is to be responsible. It is to feel shame at the sight of what seems to be unmerited misery. It is to take pride in a victory won by one's comrades. It is to feel, when setting one's stone, that one is contributing to the building of the world.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Once men are caught up in an event, they cease to be afraid. Only the unknown frightens men.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: The meaning of things lies not in the things themselves, but in our attitude towards them.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: You are responsible, forever, for what you have tamed. You are responsible for your rose.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: The notion of looking on at life has always been hateful to me. What am I if I am not a participant? In order to be, I must participate.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: He who has gone, so we but cherish his memory, abides with us, more potent, nay, more present than the living man.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: It is such a secret place, the land of tears.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: A single event can awaken within us a stranger totally unknown to us. To live is to be slowly born.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: How could there be any question of acquiring or possessing, when the one thing needful for a man is to become -- to be at last, and to die in the fullness of his being.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: I know but one freedom and that is the freedom of the mind.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Let a man in a garret but burn with enough intensity and he will set fire to the world

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Man's progress is but a gradual discovery that his questions have no meaning

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Life has taught us that love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking together in the same direction.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Life has taught us that love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Commonly, people believe that defeat is characterized by a general bustle and a feverish rush. Bustle and rush are the signs of victory, not of defeat. Victory is a thing of action. It is a house in the act of being built. Every participant in victory sweats and puffs, carrying the stones for the building of the house. But defeat is a thing of weariness, of incoherence, of boredom. And above all of futility.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: The injustice of defeat lies in the fact that its most innocent victims are made to look like heartless accomplices. It is impossible to see behind defeat, the sacrifices, the austere performance of duty, the self-discipline and the vigilance that are there -- those things the god of battle does not take account of.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Tell me who admires and loves you, and I will tell you who you are.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Love is not just looking at each other, it's looking in the same direction.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: I have no right, by anything I do or say, to demean a human being in his own eyes. What matters is not what I think of him; it is what he thinks of himself. To undermine a man's self-respect is a sin.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Transport of the mails, transport of the human voice, transport of flickering pictures --in this century as in others our highest accomplishments still have the single aim of bringing men together.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: A civilization is a heritage of beliefs, customs, and knowledge slowly accumulated in the course of centuries, elements difficult at times to justify by logic, but justifying themselves as paths when they lead somewhere, since they open up for man his inner distance.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: A civilization is built on what is required of men, not on that which is provided for them.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Charity never humiliated him who profited from it, nor ever bound him by the chains of gratitude, since it was not to him but to God that the gift was made.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Of what worth are convictions that bring not suffering?

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: You are beautiful, but you are empty. One could not die for you. To be sure, an ordinary passerby would think that my rose looked just like you--the rose that belongs to me. But in herself alone she is more important than all the hundreds of you other roses: because it is she that I have watered.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: What makes the desert beautiful is that somewhere it hides a well.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: It is in the compelling zest of high adventure and of victory, and in creative action, that man finds his supreme joys.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: The time for action is now. It's never too late to do something.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: What saves a man is to take a step. Then another step.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Whoever loves above all the approach of love will never know the joy of attaining it.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: What was my body to me? A kind of flunkey in my service. Let but my anger wax hot, my love grow exalted, my hatred collect in me, and that boasted solidarity between me and my body was gone.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: The machine does not isolate man from the great problems of nature but plunges him more deeply into them.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Loving is not just looking at each other, it's looking in the same direction.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Life has meaning only if one barters it day by day for something other than itself.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: A rock pile ceases to be a rock pile the moment a single man contemplates it, bearing within him the image of a cathedral.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: True happiness comes from the joy of deeds well done, the zest of creating things new.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: A designer knows he has achieved perfection not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.

author: Buffy Sainte-Marie
quote: Language and culture cannot be separated. Language is vital to understanding our unique cultural perspectives. Language is a tool that is used to explore and experience our cultures and the perspectives that are embedded in our cultures.

author: Buffy Sainte-Marie
quote: Instead of kids just hearing about beads and baskets and fringe, and about what 'was' and 'were,' we present Native American culture as a living contemporary culture.

author: Buffy Sainte-Marie
quote: It was a black and white only computer at the time, but it kept me fascinated.

author: Pat Sajak
quote: I suspect most self-described 18-year-old Scandinavian women named Inga who collect and wear string bikinis are, in reality, more likely to be middle-aged, pot-bellied guys named Lou who collect and wear string cheese.

author: Pat Sajak
quote: If I went in to pitch this show to a network, I would be laughed out of the room,

author: Pat Sajak

quote: It's not clear to me that the big loss to women is the loss of a woman justice, it's the loss of a moderate voice to resist the authority.

author: Anthony Schlegel
quote: It's not necessarily revenge. But it's in the back of your mind.

quote: I don't care. We're a team. We went 10-2, were No. 4 in the country. They're my best friends, and we played well together. I couldn't ask for a better college experience. It's an honor to play at Ohio State.

author: Friedrich Schlegel
quote: Prudishness is pretense of innocence without innocence. Women have to remain prudish as long as men are sentimental, dense, and evil enough to demand of them eternal innocence and lack of education. For innocence is the only thing which can ennoble lack of education.

author: Friedrich Schlegel
quote: Genius is, to be sure, not a matter of arbitrariness, but rather of freedom, just as wit, love, and faith, which once shall become arts and disciplines. We should demand genius from everybody, without, however, expecting it.

author: Friedrich Schlegel
quote: The most insignificant authors have at least this similarity to the Author of the Heavens and the Earth: that after a days work is done, they have a habit of saying to themselves, And behold, what he made was good.

author: Friedrich Schlegel
quote: It is peculiar to mankind to transcend mankind.

author: Friedrich Schlegel
quote: Virtue is reason which has become energy.

author: Friedrich Schlegel
quote: A critic is a reader who ruminates. Thus, he should have more than one stomach.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: Women do not have as great a need for poetry because their own essence is poetry.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: Women are treated as unjustly in poetry as in life. The feminine ones are not idealistic, and the idealistic not feminine.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: Witty inspirations are the proverbs of the educated.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: Wit is the appearance, the external flash of imagination. Thus its divinity, and the witty character of mysticism.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: Wit is an explosion of the compound spirit.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: Wit as an instrument of revenge is as infamous as art is as a means of sensual titillation.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: Whoever does not philosophize for the sake of philosophy, but rather uses philosophy as a means, is a sophist.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: When reason and unreason come into contact, an electrical shock occurs. This is called polemics.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: What men are among the other formations of the earth, artists are among men.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: Versatility of education can be found in our best poetry, but the depth of mankind should be found in the philosopher.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: Think of something finite molded into the infinite, and you think of man.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: There is no self-knowledge but an historical one. No one knows what he himself is who does not know his fellow men, especially the most prominent one of the community, the master's master, the genius of the age.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: There are writers in Germany who drink the Absolute like water; and there are books in which even the dogs make references to the Infinite.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: The surest method of being incomprehensible or, moreover, to be misunderstood is to use words in their original sense; especially words from the ancient languages.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: The subject of history is the gradual realization of all that is practically necessary.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: The poetry of this one is called philosophical, of that one philological, of a third rhetorical, and so on. Which is then the poetic poetry?

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: The main thing is to know something and to say it.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: The historian is a prophet looking backward.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: The German national character is a favorite subject of character experts, probably because the less mature a nation, the more she is an object of criticism and not of history.

quote: Strictly speaking, the idea of a scientific poem is probably as nonsensical as that of a poetic science.

quote: Since philosophy now criticizes everything it comes across, a critique of philosophy would be nothing less than a just reprisal.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: Reason is mechanical, wit chemical, and genius organic spirit.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: God is each truly and exalted thing, therefore the individual himself to the highest degree. But are not nature and the world individuals?

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: Every uneducated person is a caricature of himself.

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel

author: Friedrich Von Schlegel
quote: Eternal life and the invisible world are only to be sought in God. Only within Him do all spirits dwell. He is an abyss of individuality, the only infinite plenitude.

author: Mary Schmich

Like faxes, computer modems and other modern gadgets that have clogged out lives with phony urgency, cell phones represent the 20th Century's escalation of imaginary need. We didn't need cell phones until we had them. Clearly, cell phones cause not only a breakdown of courtesy, but the atrophy of basic skills.

quote: I try not to have too much of an ego. I'll do anything.

quote: A woman can laugh and cry in three seconds and it's not weird. But if a man does it, it's very disturbing. The way I'd describe it is like this: I have been allowed inside the house of womanhood, but I feel that they wouldn't let me in any of the interesting rooms.

author: Rob Schneider
quote: I lost that excitement I had when I first started out. It was all about the need to just get a job, and so I found the joy again when I was writing Deuce Bigelow. I was laughing so hard and along with my writing partner at the time, simply laughing until we cried.

quote: First it is ridiculed,Second it is violently opposed,-finally it is accepted as self evident

quote: Ordinary people merely think how they shall 'spend' their time; a man of talent tries to 'use' it.

quote: With people of limited ability modesty is merely honesty. But with those who possess great talent it is hypocrisy.

quote: There is no doubt that life is given us, not to be enjoyed, but to be overcome; to be got over.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
quote: As the biggest library if it is in disorder is not as useful as a small but well-arranged one, so you may accumulate a vast amount of knowledge but it will be of far less value than a much smaller amount if you have not thought it over for yourself.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
quote: Every nation ridicules other nations, and all are right.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer

author: Olive Schreiner
quote: Power! Did you ever hear of men being asked whether other souls should have power or not? It is born in them.

author: Olive Schreiner
quote: From our earliest hour we have been taught that the thought of the heart, the shaping of the rain-cloud, the amount of wool that grows on a sheep's back, the length of a drought, and the growing of the corn, depend on nothing that moves immutable, at the heart of all things; but on the changeable will of a changeable being, whom our prayers can alter. To us, from the beginning, Nature has been but a poor plastic thing, to be toyed with this way or that, as man happens to please his deity or not; to go to church or not; to say his prayers right or not; to travel on a Sunday or not. Was it possible for us in an instant to see Nature as she is --the flowing vestment of an unchanging reality?

author: Olive Schreiner
quote: We all enter the world little plastic beings, with so much natural force, perhaps, but for the rest -- blank; and the world tells us what we are to be, and shapes us by the ends it sets before us. To you it says -- Work; and to us it says -- Seem! To you it says -- As you approximate to man's highest ideal of God, as your arm is strong and your knowledge great, and the power to labor is with you, so you shall gain all that human heart desires. To us it says -- Strength shall not help you, nor knowledge, nor labor. You shall gain what men gain, but by other means. And so the world makes men and women.

author: Olive Schreiner
quote: A little weeping, a little wheedling, a little self-degradation, a little careful use of our advantages, and then some man will say ''.Come, be my wife!'' With good looks and youth marriage is easy to attain. There are men enough; but a woman who has sold herself, even for a ring and a new name, need hold her skirt aside for no creature in the street. They both earn their bread in one way. Marriage for love is the most beautiful external symbol of the union of souls; marriage without it is the least clean traffic that defiles the world.

author: Olive Schreiner
quote: Perhaps the old monks were right when they tried to root love out; perhaps the poets are right when they try to water it. It is a blood-red flower, with the color of sin; but there is always the scent of a god about it.

When it sinned and when it suffered something like a dead hand would fall on me, -- ''You did it, you, for your own pleasure you created this thing! See your work!'' If it lived to be eighty it would always hang like a millstone round my neck, have the right to demand good from me, and curse me for its sorrow. A parent is only like to God: if his work turns out bad so much the worse for him; he dare not wash his hands of it. Time and years can never bring the day when you can say to your child, ''Soul, what have I to do with you?''

author: Peter Sellars
quote: [He is particularly proud of the inclusion in this scene of a petition signed by 70 scientists asking Truman not to bomb Japan. author: Peter Sellars

author: Peter Sellars

A conversation that goes along with individual source material just takes off, and things start ricocheting and having surprising connections or counterbalances. You're always looking for yin and yang so the drama thrives on contrasts and contradictions.

author: Peter Sellars
quote: In these times in America I am very moved and grateful that the Gish Prize has chosen to support diversity, controversy, complexity, and non-conformity. I am a collaborative artist, and I accept this recognition on behalf of the courageous artists who have opened and challenged new worlds and old, in a body of work that has created shared space on a divided planet.

author: Sue Semrau
quote: I am really proud of our players because there has been a lot of hard work on their part. The thing I'm really excited about is we will be playing on neutral courts. It was a tough route going up to Connecticut last season. We can deal with altitude but it's a lot more difficult to go out and play on a home court. Louisiana Tech is a great team. I know Chris Long well and he has done a great job as a first-year coach. It will be a tough one out there but it's something we will look forward to. We know we have to go out to Denver and take care of business. We can only take it one game at a time and we won't look past anything.

We feel like we have as much confidence as we've ever had.

author: Gary Shapiro
quote: Consumers are realizing the benefits of in-car entertainment and navigation systems. When used properly, these products are great tools that help drivers focus on the road. author: Gary Shapiro
quote: While accessory items and embedded features help minimize driver distraction, nothing replaces simple common-sense when using a cell phone in the car. Pull over to the side of the road to dial manually, know the features and functions of your phone before you drive and allow voice mail to pick up your calls if you are driving - these are all simple and commonsensical steps we can all take to minimize distraction from in-car cell phone use.

author: Natan Sharansky
quote: When we are unwilling to draw clear moral lines between free societies and fear societies, when we are unwilling to call the former good and the latter evil, we will not be able to advance the cause of peace because peace cannot be disconnected from freedom.

That's democracy; and a splendid thing it is too for putting the right men in the right place.

author: Sidney Sheldon
quote: Talent is a gift that can be given, and it can be taken away. We have to appreciate that.

author: Sidney Sheldon
quote: Stories had always been told about male genies coming out of bottles, but they were usually fat, old men. Never had the genie been a gorgeous woman, so that idea really appealed to me, and I created the series based on that premise.

author: Sidney Sheldon
quote: I think people throughout the world identify with my characters.

author: Sidney Sheldon
quote: I go to great lengths to make certain situations feel right to the reader.

author: Sidney Sheldon
quote: I always spend time exploring the customs and attitudes of the countries I'm using for locations, and interviewing the people who live there. I've visited over 90 countries thus far.

author: Rupert Sheldrake
quote: Well, natural selection was an idea that Darwin developed by analogy with conscious human selection. That's where he got the idea from.

author: Rupert Sheldrake
quote: Well, I'm always hoping to hear from interested chemists and protein chemists, because I'd love for these experiments to be done properly.

author: Rupert Sheldrake
quote: There's a certain kind of scepticism that can't bear uncertainty.

author: Rupert Sheldrake
quote: The point of what I'm doing is to talk not about science backed up by hundreds of committees, thousands of professors, and many tons of textbooks.

author: Rupert Sheldrake
quote: The mechanistic theory of nature is a theory of nature, and one that I think is wrong, or at least too limited. It's not an eternal truth.

author: Rupert Sheldrake
quote: The idea is that there is a kind of memory in nature. Each kind of thing has a collective memory. So, take a squirrel living in New York now. That squirrel is being influenced by all past squirrels.

author: Rupert Sheldrake
quote: Right now, any opinion anyone has about whether dogs can or cannot really tell when their owner is coming home by some unknown means... nobody knows. The weight of evi dence suggests they can.

author: Rupert Sheldrake
quote: Of the seven experiments, the ones that have been most investigated so far have been the pets. The dogs who know when their masters for coming home, and the sense of being stared at.

author: Rupert Sheldrake
quote: Now the whole point about machines is they are designed not to be random. When you call up a word processing program on your computer, you don't want it to be different every time you call it up. You want it to stay the same.

author: Rupert Sheldrake
quote: Most of nature is inherently chaotic. It's not rigidly determined in the old sense. It's not rigidly predictable.

author: Rupert Sheldrake
quote: I'm talking about science on the leading edge, where it's not clear which way things are going be cause we don't know, and I'm dealing with areas which we don't know about.

author: Rupert Sheldrake
quote: Because a truly skeptical position would be a very uncertain one.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
quote: January gray is here, like a sexton by her grave; February bears the bier, march with grief doth howl and rave, and April weeps - but, O ye hours! Follow with May's fairest flowers.

quote: The pleasure that is in sorrow is sweeter than the pleasure of pleasure itself.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Only nature knows how to justly proportion to the fault the punishment it deserves.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

author: Alan Shepard
quote: You've done it in the simulator so many times, you don't have a real sense of being excited when the flight is going on. You're excited before, but as soon as the liftoff occurs, you are busy doing what you have to do.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: You may not have any extra talent, but maybe you are just paying more attention to what you are doing.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: Whether you are an astronomer or a life scientist, geophysicist, or a pilot, you've got to be there because you believe you are good in your field, and you can contribute, not because you are going to get a lot of fame or whatever when you get back.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: We worked with the engineers in the design and construction and testing phases in those various areas, then we would get back together at the end of the week and brief each other as to what had gone on.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: We wanted to be in great shape, we wanted to be able to cope with zero gravity, we wanted to be able to cope with accelerations and decelerations and so on. So all of us trained so that we were probably in the best physical condition we had ever been in up until that point.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: They say any landing you can walk away from is a good one.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: Then there was the challenge to keep doing better and better, to fly the best test flight that anybody had ever flown. That led to my being recognized as one of the more experienced test pilots, and that led to the astronaut business.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: The rocket had worked perfectly, and all I had to do was survive the reentry forces. You do it all, in a flight like that, in a rather short period of time, just 16 minutes as a matter of fact.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: The pilot looked at his cues of attitude and speed and orientation and so on and responded as he would from the same cues in an airplane, but there was no way it flew the same. The simulators had showed us that.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: The first plane ride was in a homemade glider my buddy and I built. Unfortunately we didn't get more than four feet off the ground, because it crashed.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: The excitement really didn't start to build until the trailer - which was carrying me, with a space suit with ventilation and all that sort of stuff - pulled up to the launch pad.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: So everything turned out fine, and we were given the opportunity to go to Washington and be briefed on the project of man in space, and given the opportunity to choose whether we wanted to get involved or not.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: So even though we were there competing with each other for the first ride, we were still acting as a team, and helping each other in those days.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: Of course I was delighted the flight was over, but I still had to worry about cleaning up inside the cabin, I had to worry about the hatch, how to get in the sling, and so on.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: Obviously I was challenged by becoming a Naval aviator, by landing aboard aircraft carriers and so on.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: Later, in the early teens, I used to ride my bike every Saturday morning to the nearest airport, ten miles away, push airplanes in and out of the hangars, and clean up the hangars.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: It's a very sobering feeling to be up in space and realize that one's safety factor was determined by the lowest bidder on a government contract.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: I woke up an hour before I was supposed to, and started going over the mental checklist: where do I go from here, what do I do? I don't remember eating anything at all, just going through the physical, getting into the suit. We practiced that so much, it was all rote.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: I think the sense of family and family achievement, plus the discipline which I received there from that one-room school were really very helpful in what I did later on.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: I think all of us certainly believed the statistics which said that probably 88% chance of mission success and maybe 96% chance of survival. And we were willing to take those odds.

author: Alan Shepard

author: Alan Shepard

author: Alan Shepard
quote: And I think that still is true of this business - which is basically research and development - that you probably spend more time in planning and training and designing for things to go wrong, and how you cope with them, than you do for things to go right.

author: Alan Shepard

author: Ian Shepherdson

Given the strong trend in mortgage applications, these data likely do not signal real housing weakness.

author: Quin Snyder

author: Quin Snyder

author: Susan Sontag
quote: The standard that a society should actually embody its own professed principles is a utopian one, in the sense that moral principles contradict the way things really are --- and always will be. How things really are --- and always will be --- is neither all-evil nor all-good but deficient, inconsistent, inferior. Principles invite us to do something about the morass of contradictions in which we function morally. Principles invite us to clean up our act; to become intolerant of moral laxity and compromise and cowardice and the turning away from what is upsetting: that secret gnawing of the heart that tells us that what we are doing is not right, and so counsels us that we'd be better off just not thinking about it.

author: Susan Sontag

Here Camp taste supervenes upon good taste as a daring and witty hedonism. It makes the man of good taste cheerful, where before he ran the risk of being chronically frustrated. It is good for the digestion.

author: Susan Sontag

author: Thomas Sowell
quote: Considering the enormous range of human knowledge, from intimate personal knowledge of specific individuals to the complexities of organizations and the subtleties of feelings, it is remarkable that one speck in this firmament should be the sole determinant of whether someone is considered knowledgeable or ignorant in general. Yet it is a fact of life that an unlettered person is considered ignorant, however much he may know about nature and man, and a Ph.D. is never considered ignorant, however barren his mind might be outside his narrow specialty and however little he grasps about human feeling or social complexities.

author: Thomas Sowell
quote: Physicists have determined that even the most solid and heavy mass of matter we see is mostly empty space. But at the submicroscopic level, specks of matter scattered through a vast emptiness have such incredible density and weight, and are linked to one another by such powerful forces, that together they produce all the properties of concrete, cast iron and solid rock. In much the same way, specks of knowledge are scattered through a vast emptiness of ignorance, and everything depends upon how solid the individual specks of knowledge are, and on how powerfully linked and coordinated they are with one another.

author: Thomas Sowell

author: Thomas Sowell

The wider that strip of land and the more sensitive the player is to the changing composition of the ground under his feet as he pursues the ball, the more effective the warning. Romanticizing or lionizing as individualistic those people who disregard social cues and inducements increases the danger of head-on collisions with inherent social limits. Decrying various forms of social disapproval is in effect narrowing the warning strip.

author: Thomas Sowell
quote: Given that some social processes must convey inherent constraints, the choice is among various mixtures of persuasion, force, and cultural inducement. The less of one, the more of the others. The degree of freedom that is possible is therefore tied to the extent to which people respond to persuasion or inducement.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: Every great man, every successful man, no matter what the field of endeavor, has known the magic that lies in these words: every adversity has the seed of an equivalent or greater benefit.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: Success is achieved and maintained by those who try and keep trying.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: Be careful the environment you choose for it will shape you; be careful the friends you choose for you will become like them.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: Truth will always be truth, regardless of lack of understanding, disbelief or ignorance.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: When you discover your mission, you will feel its demand. It will fill you with enthusiasm and a burning desire to get to work on it.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: If you employed study, thinking, and planning time daily, you could develop and use the power that can change the course of your destiny.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: Everyone who achieves success in a great venture, solves each problem as they came to it. They helped themselves. And they were helped through powers known and unknown to them at the time they set out on their voyage. They keep going regardless of the obstacles they met.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: Keep your mind on your objective, and persist until you succeed. Study, think and plan.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: You. too, can determine what you want. You can decide on your major objectives, targets, aims, and destination.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: To solve a problem or to reach a goal, you don't need to know all the answers in advance. But you must have a clear idea of the problem or the goal you want to reach.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: Be generous! Give to those you love? give to those who love you? give to thefortunate? give to the unfortunate yes, give especially to those you don't want togive. You will receive abundance for your giving. The more you give, the moreyou will have!

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: Give a smile to everyone you meet (smile with your eyes) and you'll smile and receive smiles.

author: W. Clement Stone

author: W. Clement Stone

author: W. Clement Stone

author: W. Clement Stone

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: Whatever the mind of man can conceive, it can achieve.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: To every disadvantage there is a corresponding advantage.

author: W. Clement Stone

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: Big doors swing on little hinges.

author: W. Clement Stone

author: W. Clement Stone

quote: No matter how carefully you plan your goals they will never be more than pipe dreams unless you pursue them with gusto.

author: W. Clement Stone

author: W. Clement Stone

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: If you are really thankful, what do you do? You share.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: Whatever the mind of man can conceive and believe, it can achieve.

quote: No matter how carefully you plan your goals they will never be more that pipe dreams unless you pursue them with gusto.

It is more important than the past, the education, the money, than circumstances, than failure, than successes, than what other people think or say or do. It is more important than appearance, giftedness or skill. It will make or break a company... a church... a home. The remarkable thing is we have a choice everyday regarding the attitude we will embrace for that day. We cannot change our past... we cannot change the fact that people will act in a certain way. We cannot change the inevitable. The only thing we can do is play on the one string we have, and that is our attitude. I am convinced that life is 10% what happens to me and 90% of how I react to it. And so it is with you... we are in charge of our Attitudes.

quote: He who flees from trial confesses his guilt

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: Do not despise the bottom rungs in the ascent to greatness.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: One ungrateful person, does an injury to all needy people.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: To accept a benefit is to sell one's freedom

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: It is more easy to get a favor from fortune than to keep it

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: When Fortune flatters, she does it to betray

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: Fortune is like glass--the brighter the glitter, the more easily broken.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: He whom many fear, has himself many to fear.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: He must fear many whom many fear

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: It is an unhappy lot which finds no enemies.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: It is a pitiful fortune that is not without enemies.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: It is only the ignorant who despise education.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: We desire nothing so much as what we ought not to have

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: That should be considered long which can be decided but once.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: A small debt produces a debtor; a large one, an enemy

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: To dispute with a drunkard is to debate with an empty house

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: He is most free from danger, who, even when safe, is on his guard

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: No one reaches a high position without daring.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: Even when there is no law, there is conscience

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: Speech is the mirror of the soul; as a man speaks, so is he.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: We are born princes and the civilizing process makes us frogs.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: It is a good thing to learn caution from the misfortunes of others.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: When you confer a benefit on those worthy of it, you confer a favor on all.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: The wise man avoids evil by anticipating it.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: You should make a woman angry if you wish her to love

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: The bare recollection of anger kindles anger.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: It is bad advice that cannot be changed.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: Many receive advice, only the wise profit from it.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: Prosperity makes friends, adversity tries them

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: From the errors of others, a wise man corrects his own.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: A good reputation is more valuable than money.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: How unhappy is he who cannot forgive himself.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: An angry father is most cruel towards himself.

author: Henrietta Szold
quote: Women were freed from positive duties when they could not perform them, but not when they could.

author: Henrietta Szold
quote: To the rest of us the supreme vindication of the scholar's view lies in their invincible allegiance to the Jewish heritage - a steadfastness that has been matched only by that of their rescuers.

author: Henrietta Szold
quote: In the life of the spirit there is no ending that is not a beginning.

author: Henrietta Szold
quote: I would exchange everything for one child of my own.

author: Wislawa Szymborska
quote: Take it not amiss, O speech, that I borrow weighty words, and later try hard to make them seem light.

author: Wislawa Szymborska
quote: Nothing can ever happen twice. In consequence, the sorry fact is that we arrive here improvised and leave without the chance to practice.

author: Wislawa Szymborska
quote: Poetic talent doesn't operate in a vacuum. There is a spirit of Polish poetry.

author: Wislawa Szymborska
quote: Poets yearn, of course, to be published, read, and understood, but they do little, if anything, to set themselves above the common herd and the daily grind.

author: Wislawa Szymborska
quote: All is mine but nothing owned, nothing owned for memory, and mine only while I look.

author: Wislawa Szymborska
quote: I started earning a living as a poet rather early on.

author: Wislawa Szymborska
quote: Any knowledge that doesn't lead to new questions quickly dies out: it fails to maintain the temperature required for sustaining life.

author: Wislawa Szymborska
quote: Though I may deny poets their monopoly on inspiration, I still place them in a select group of Fortune's darlings.

author: Wislawa Szymborska
quote: Let the people who never find true love keep saying that there's no such thing. Their faith will make it easier for them to live and die.

author: Wislawa Szymborska
quote: In every tragedy, an element of comedy is preserved. Comedy is just tragedy reversed.

author: Wislawa Szymborska
quote: Is a decision made in advance really any kind of choice.

author: Wislawa Szymborska
quote: All the best have something in common, a regard for reality, an agreement to its primacy over the imagination.

author: Wislawa Szymborska
quote: Poorly prepared for the dignity of life, I barely keep up with the pace of the action imposed. Reality demands.
